result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Valentine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse county Clerk of courts

supervisions.notes:
During the period of prison incarceration, 25% of the defendant's prison inmate funds are to be applied to restitution owed, according to prison policy
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution from 13CM1528. He can have a hearing on it.

During period of Extended Supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.
.

The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment or enroll in a course of education or a combination of both.
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician or drug para, with random screenings.

  No bars or taverns
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow thru with any treatment recommendations.
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd A Valentine

records.addlTxt: for Civil Judgment signed EML
Meredith Davis
to EML from Attorney Allan Beatty re: Def wishes to withdraw his request for early release.

Petition for Sentence Adjustment, Verification of Time Served, Notice to District Attorney all filed in November 2014.
Letter and Notice to District Attorney - Object to Petition for Sentence Adjustment filed December 16, 2014
Notes from EML - This Request Is Withdrawn, dated 01-13-15.

from EML  to: def   re: CRT has rec'd def's letter.  CRT did not realize DOC would interpret my Order as requiring them to w/hold 25% of prison funds for restitution AND 25% for Court costs.  CRT expected DOC to take 25% total.  Payment of CRT costs can wait until def is released, but it is important that restitution gets paid.  CRT is instructing the COC to amend JOC to reflect that only rest. be paid from prison funds in accordance w/ prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross.  Once def is released on Extended Supervision, def must work w/ PO to set up an acceptable payment plan to address both restitution and crt costs, as well as supervision fees & any other outstanding obligations you have.  Lastly, the additional 10% of funds the DOC w/holds from prison funds is used to set up a Release Account for the def - DOC is required to w/hold that money on def's behalf & disburse it to def when released - CRT has no authority over this.

from Def    re: Req CRT modify JOC to not have restitution taken out of prison funds & restitution to begin when Ext. Sup begins
PER EML:  DENIED
DOC-31 filed - signed by EML

Ltr from def

10 am Def in court w/ Atty Allan E. Beatty.  Def in custody.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Victim notification has been complied with.  Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands.  Amended Information filed.

14CF-154   Count 1 - Fleeing an Officer (Fel)  346.04(3)   GUILTY     Count 2 - Dismissed but read-in
13CM1528  Dismissed but read-in

Plea Questionnaire filed.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the plea is F, V & I made.  Rights F & V waived.  Factual basis.  Accepts plea.  Found guilty and convicted.

Minser and Beatty don't feel another PSI is needed.  Felicia Millard gives statements.  Minser comments and asks the court to follow the recommendations in 13CF-553.  Beatty comments and asks for probation.  He would also like to go to his uncle's funeral on Saturday.  He's still on extended supervision.  We're asking for a hearing on the restitution in 13CM-1528.  Valentine comments.  Court comments.

SENTENCES:
14CF-154
Total:  3 yrs prison
Initial:  1 yr  w/ 50 days credit
Ext. Sup.:  2 yrs

Conditions:
AODA and follow through
Full time employment or education
No alcohol or controlled substances w/o Rx from a Dr.
No bars or taverns
No drug para
Any other counselling deemed appropriate by PO
CC and DOC fees
He is eligible for the EAP  but not eligible for the CIP
Restition of $616 (includes schg) in 13CM-1528 but he can have a hearing on it.

13CF-553
Total:  10 mos CJ - concurrent with 14CF-154 w/ 35 days credit

Appeal rights advised.
